intro: Swertia veratroides, commonly known as the blue poppy, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers are tubular with five petals. Swertia veratroides is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens that mimic its natural habitat.
